meanings.definition: Fires that are set to prevent the spread of a larger fire.
meanings.sent1: The firefighters quickly lit counterfires to stop the wildfire from spreading.
meanings.sent2: The strategy of using counterfires proved effective in containing the forest fire.
meanings.sent3: The counterfires danced brightly against the night sky, like guardians protecting the forest.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to fight the flames was like a series of well-placed counterfires in her life.
meanings.sent5: The smell of smoke filled the air as the counterfires roared, battling the encroaching blaze.

meanings.definition: To return fire in response to an enemy attack.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers counterfired as soon as they detected enemy movement.
meanings.sent2: He counterfires whenever the enemy tries to advance.
meanings.sent3: The cat counterfires playfully with its toy mouse, mimicking a fierce battle.
meanings.sent4: His quick wit counterfires any insult thrown his way.
meanings.sent5: The team counterfires with precision, never letting the opponent gain an advantage.
